poem:
Title: "In The Dream of Her Sameness"

Mid-November dreaming, she unlocks beauty in plastic- 
Blonde threads of satin cascading her silver chair, 
Rainbowed playsuit, ramp pinkly defiant.  
Mirror of childhood diversity, brightly balanced, 
A small brick shifts in the construction of dreams. 
Her hands embrace the wheels, spins fairytales from the rims - 
She is the future - sees not landfill, but stars instead.
